snippet: Instead of opioids, an E.R. in New Jersey now treats many pain patients with alternatives like laughing gas, trigger-point injections and even a therapy harp.
abstract: Emergency room at St Joseph's Regional Medical Center in Paterson, NJ, crafts strategy to combat rising tide of opiod and herion addiction that relegates opioids to last-resort treatment; instead hospital opts for treatments including nonnarcotic infusions and injections, ultrasound guided nerve blocks and energy healing to address acute pain.
lead_paragraph: Instead of opioids, an E.R. in New Jersey now treats many pain patients with alternatives like laughing gas, trigger-point injections and even a therapy harp.

headline.main: An E.R. Kicks the Habit of Opioids for Pain
